arts.ttl: Serie A | Como 1-1 Parma: Match report
arts.sum: Como and Parma shared the spoils in an entertaining 1-1 draw at the Stadio Giuseppe Sinigaglia. The match featured two stunning goals from promising young talents. Parma took the lead through a moment of brilliance from Ange-Yoan Bonny. The striker produced a sensational back-heel flick to divert Hernani’s cross into the far corner, reminiscent of a famous Hernan Crespo goal for Parma in years past. However, Como fought back and equalized through Nico Paz, who celebrated his first Serie A goal just days after making his senior debut for Argentina. arts.ttl: OFFICIAL: Raphael Varane lands new job after shock retirement
arts.sum: Raphael Varane has been officially appointed to Como's board after his surprise retirement. The ex- Real Madrid star then joined Cesc Fabregas' Serie A new boys Como but suffered a long-term knee injury just minutes into his debut.

arts.ttl: Raphael Varane lands new job after shock retirement
arts.sum: "Transitioning from the field to the boardroom isn't the end of my football journey; it's a new beginning that I'm looking forward to. As part of his agreement with Como, who were promoted to Serie A last season, Varane has now taken up a boardroom role to help the club continue with their ambitious project.

arts.ttl: Raphael Varane joins Como’s board of directors
arts.sum: Former Manchester United and Real Madrid defender Raphael Varane has been appointed to the Board of Directors of Como 1907, just weeks after announcing his retirement from professional football. The Italian club made the official announcement on Saturday via their official website. Varane’s new role will focus on youth development and educational projects, working closely with Como’s Head of Development, Osian Roberts, and educational program manager, Juliette Martin. The French World Cup winner aims to help young athletes grow both on and off the pitch by integrating academic training, leadership development, and professional growth into youth programs.
